This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 adolescents and young people benefit from improved social policies and systems to reduce risks affecting their health and development, and are empowered for meaningful participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 04120443 2020 national and sub-national mechanisms established to promote adolescents' civic participation

description.narrative: A key programme priority for the CO was to empower adolescents and young people to formulate positive behaviour models and engage with society on issues that are critical for their well-being and development. Over 2020, the CO continued to build adolescents’ and young people’s capacities while adapting to the changing circumstances caused by COVID-19. Online courses and tools were developed to capacitate adolescents and youth with knowledge and skills to become proactive in addressing critical issues, such as COVID-19 and other issues of concern in their communities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2021
